title: Requesting an apartment from a rental agent
context: Tell a leasing agent you want to rent a two-bedroom apartment.

content.bestLine: I'm interested in renting a two-bedroom apartment.

neutral.text: I'm looking for a two-bedroom apartment.
Do you have two-bedroom apartments available?
I want to rent a two-bedroom apartment.
Can you show me a two-bedroom apartment?
I'm interested in a two-bedroom apartment.
Do you have any two-bedroom apartments for rent?

informal.text: I'm looking for a two-bedroom, what's available?
Can I check out a two-bedroom apartment?
What's the deal with your two-bedroom apartments?
I'm in the market for a two-bedroom apartment.
Can you hook me up with a two-bedroom?

formal.text: I would like to inquire about renting a two-bedroom apartment.
Could you please show me a two-bedroom apartment?
I am interested in renting a two-bedroom apartment, please.
Do you have any two-bedroom apartments available for rent?
I would appreciate it if you could show me a two-bedroom apartment.
I am looking for a two-bedroom apartment to rent, thank you.

patterns.meaning: Expressing interest in a specific type of apartment.

patterns.template: Can you show me a [options] apartment?
patterns.meaning: Requesting to see a specific type of apartment.

dialogs.description: Requesting a two-bedroom apartment from a leasing agent.

lines.speaker: Customer
lines.text: Hi, I'm interested in renting a two-bedroom apartment.

lines.speaker: Leasing Agent
lines.text: Great, we have a few options available. Let me show you some of our two-bedroom apartments.

dialogs.description: Asking about the availability of two-bedroom apartments.

lines.speaker: Customer
lines.text: Do you have any two-bedroom apartments available for rent?

lines.speaker: Leasing Agent
lines.text: Yes, we have a few two-bedroom apartments available. Would you like to take a look?
